thread.title: 60-year-old woman among 2 shot in Austin | Chicago Sun-Times
thread.title_full: 60-year-old woman among 2 shot in Austin | Chicago Sun-Times

title: 60-year-old woman among 2 shot in Austin | Chicago Sun-Times
text: Sign-Up for our News & Politics Newsletter Sign-Up A 60-year-old woman and a 20-year-old man were shot Thursday afternoon in the West Side Austin neighborhood. The man was standing on the corner about 1:45 p.m. in the 5700 block of West Chicago and talking on a cellphone when someone walked up and fired shots, according to Chicago Police. The man was shot in the abdomen and leg and taken in critical condition to Stroger Hospital, police said. The woman was shot in the leg and was initially taken to Loyola University Medical Center in Maywood, then transferred to Stroger, police said. Her condition had stabilized. A police source said the man is a documented gang member. The woman was not the intended target. Previously from Chicago News
